snippet: The equipment failure at a Harvard brain bank could set autism research back for years.
abstract: Freezer failure at the world’s largest brain bank, the Harvard Brain Tissue Resource Center in Belmont, Mass, damages nearly 150 brains, including one-third of those used in studying autism; scientists say that failure could set autism research back for years.
lead_paragraph: The equipment failure at a Harvard brain bank could set autism research back for years.

headline.seo: Broken Freezer Damages Stored Brain Tissues
headline.main: Brain Bank’s Freezer Failure Could Slow Autism Research
headline.print_headline: Brain Bank’s Freezer Failure Could Slow Autism Research
